Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Double Login after Registration ByRole" (#2885) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi programmers, i don't know is it a problem or a question.

There is two roles in my application, and after registration i give them roles like this:
`UserManager.AddToRole(userId: user.Id, role: "Teacher");`
and it redirects to action of Controller which is only for "Teachers" role, made like this
```
[Authorize(Roles = "Teacher")] 
public class TeacherController : Controller
```
The problem is that application wants users to relogin to the application, and only then gives them permission to view webpage. 

How to make sure that he doesn't pass authorization again?

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Login after Registration Error" (#2885) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi programmers, here's a problem or a question.

There is two roles in my application, and after registratin they signIn and i give them role like this:
`UserManager.AddToRole(userId: user.Id, role: "Teacher");`
and redirect to action of Controller which is only for "Teachers" role, made like this
`[Authorize(Roles = "Teacher")]`
The problem is that application wants users to relogin to the application, and only then gives him to view page. 

How to make sure that he doesn't pass authorization again?

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable scenario with RSA certificate not being stored in the certificate store." (#2321) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @nenadvicentic on Wednesday, December 13, 2017 2:07:26 AM_

Current implementation of `EncryptedXmlDecryptor` is dependent on the Windows certificate store.

While it is possible to specify "standalone" certificate for encryption for `CertificateXmlEncryptor` via constructor accepting `X509Certificate2`, `EncryptedXmlDecryptor` will search for the same certificate in the Windows certificate store based on it's thumbnail and crush.

All that is needed for this is to add additional line in `Decrypt` method of `EncryptedXmlDecryptor`:

```
            // Perform the decryption and update the document in-place.
            var encryptedXml = new EncryptedXml(xmlDocument);
            encryptedXml.AddKeyNameMapping(x509Certificate2.Thumbprint, x509Certificate2.PrivateKey); // new line
            _decryptor.PerformPreDecryptionSetup(encryptedXml);
            encryptedXml.DecryptDocument();
```

Only thing missing would be to pass `X509Certificate2` to decryptor.

Currently, to achieve same thing, one has to make completely new implementation of `IXmlEncryptor`, `IXmlDecryptor` and related extension methods for `IDataProtectBuilder` configuration.

_Copied from original issue: aspnet/DataProtection#290_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Support multiple key decryption certificates without X509Store" (#2884) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When using the X509Store, you can decrypt an old key encrypted XML key with multiple certificates. 

In https://github.com/aspnet/DataProtection/pull/299, we added support for decrypting without using the X509Store for one certificate (the one passed to .ProtectKeysWithCertificate()). This doesn't yet support multiple certs though. It wouldn't be too hard to support this.

Usage:
```c#
.AddDataProtection()
.ProtectKeysWithCertificate(certificate)
.UseKeyDecryptionCertificates(oldCert1, oldCert2, oldCert3)
```

Closed issue "Remove automatic Upgrade header logic from UpgradeAsync" (#2086) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/aspnet/KestrelHttpServer/blob/a31d1e024ca86a4a9053e0be105fde17c5ccae10/src/Kestrel.Core/Internal/Http/Http1Connection.FeatureCollection.cs#L42-L50
This code copies the request Upgrade header to the response. However, the request Upgrade header is a list of suggestions, while the response is the ordered list of actually selected protocols. Setting any of these response headers is the caller's responsibility. The WebSocket middleware sets these.
https://github.com/aspnet/WebSockets/blob/31c1e9d7d727fda23ae657cb3598c7c3f3950d15/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebSockets/Internal/HandshakeHelpers.cs#L66-L75

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230#section-6.7

This method is also missing a HasResponseStarted check. It will fail only when it tries to set the StatusCode.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Removed automatic Upgrade header logic from UpgradeAsync to fix issue 2086" (#2329) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
Removed automatic Upgrade header logic from UpgradeAsync to fix issue #2086

- Removed code to set response headers -  connection and upgrade as it should be  set by caller e.g. WebSockets Middleware
- Fixed test cases - as connection would be set to "close" instead of "upgrade" after removing headers

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Removed automatic Upgrade header logic from UpgradeAsync (#2086)." (#2300) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody: Fixes #2086.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Fix connection management with connection middleware" (#2335) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody: Today Kestrel exposes the `IConnectionBuilder` interface but connection management is only implemented in the HttpConnectionMiddleware. To properly port existing connection adapters to connection middleware, we need to move the connection management up a layer.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Socket Transport " (#1686) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
- [x] - The functional tests support running both on both transports but tests aren't running for sockets right now. We need to parameterize these. 
- [x] - ~~TimeoutServerTests hard code the libuv transport, this needs to support any transport.~~
- [x] - Get the socket transport on the benchmarks server (https://github.com/aspnet/benchmarks/issues/250)
- [x] - Add logging to the SocketsTransport, today it has nothing
- [x] - Add thread pool dispatching by default. We may not get time to do this properly for 2.0.0 https://github.com/aspnet/KestrelHttpServer/issues/1641, so until then, we should just abuse thread pool dispatch and offer knobs on the transport to turn it off.
- [x] - The systemd activation test assumes we can bind using a unix pipe and an open file descriptor. We need to only run that test when using the libuv transport as sockets only supports binding via and IPEndPoint.
- [x] - Implement graceful server shutdown
- [x] - Throw reasonable exceptions for unsupported ListenOptions
- [ ] - Add SocketTransportOptions
- [ ] - Smarter Output Buffering 
- [ ] - 0 byte reads to help the memory issues
- [x] - Use the new Memory<byte> APIs in .NET Core 2.1
- [ ] - Security review

None of the performance work is listed here specifically since that will be on going. We need to experiment with different ways of using `SocketAsyncEventArgs` to see if what we have is the most efficient.

One other note is that we aren't doing 0 byte reads right now (which libuv *does* so), this is usually done to avoid allocating until data is ready but we'll see how it affects both memory and throughput.

/cc @geoffkizer @stephentoub

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SocketTransport should do 0 byte reads to avoid allocating memory for idle connections" (#2334) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody: This is an important issue for efficient websocket support. A common pattern for avoiding memory use  of idle connections is to only allocate a buffer when there's data. This is what libuv does internally but sockets requires a buffer to be passed into ReadAsync. Today we're allocating a 4K block per idle connection.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Decouple tooling from MVC assemblies" (#2033) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody: As a proof-of-concept, this drops all hardcoding between the Razor tooling code and the MVC functionality for VCTH and code generation. There are still some shims that are required, and where to place them is a bit tricky for layering reasons.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Codes to store c# codes" (#2087) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
If there is Pages, why not "codes" to store codes.

I'm aware the use case for asp.net teams is to use visual studio/source control -> build -> deploy
but there is this people like me who need to keep everything on the fly during runtime.

I know I can use c# script but there is a plan to make view compile updateable which means a good time to propose to make code also updateable.

At this moment if I need to add new code api I have to
- use c# script
- use c# script then compile, save dll somewhere, reference the dll and use c# script to call it (cumbersome)
- download the projects from source control, add the code, build dll and publish...

or just make it possible to call methods stored in razor page from another razor page?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "On demand razor view compile" (#2086) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm aware about the plan to make razor views precompiled views updateable
At this moment I can't use precompiled views because its not updateable (duh)

My question is, is there any plan to make the view compile on demand?
It seems the plan is to make it automatic only, after a view is changed.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12871379/36367407-d1200256-1552-11e8-8e0c-7f05f3fdcf1e.png)

Will it improve of cold startup or performance after inactivity?
As you can see in the picture, I have 18 seconds due no interaction with the website for some time.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Publish ASP.NET 5 Web Application to remote IIS " (#292) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
In Visual Studio 2015, I can successfully preview / publish to a remote IIS server with a 4.6 Web application. However, publishing fails when using an ASP.NET 5 template / web applications, it will not even provide a preview.

Is it possible to publish an ASP.NET 5 web application at the current time using Visual Studio 2015 / Publish to a remote IIS server?

If so, is there any instructions on doing this? (not for local IIS).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Manage Bower Packages: Update button should disable upon clicking" (#1010) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
Here are the steps to reproduce in VS 2017:

1. Use the ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Core) project template to create a new ASP.NET Core 1.1 Web Application with No Authentication.
1. Right-click the web project in Solution Explorer, and select **Manage Bower Packages...**.
1. From the **Installed** tab, click the **Update** button for the Bootstrap package. Notice that the button doesn't disable after it's been clicked, yet the update is occurring.

This **Update** button should be disabled while the package update is in progress. Otherwise, the following command is executed each time the button is clicked: `"C:\Users\Scott Addie\AppData\Roaming\npm\Bower.cmd" install bootstrap#v4.0.0-alpha.6 --force-latest --save`.

In the screenshot below, you see what happens when I click the button 3 times in a row:

![bower_update](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10702007/23536562/5c5589f6-ff8b-11e6-8c22-7aa322a802d9.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Format on paste setting does not work in .cshtml (Razor - VS 2015)" (#914) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
When disabling format on paste for C# + HTML in the Visual Studio settings, usually code does not get formatted on paste (as expected)

In razor files, when you copy and past something like this statement:
```csharp
@Html.AttributeEncode("test")
```
it also works as intended.

However when you mark the "." (dot) and do something like cut (Ctlr+X) and paste (Ctlr+V) (or just paste), 
the html helper call gets formatted (in our case like this):
```csharp
@Html.AttributeEncode ("test")
```

This is ***unexpected and even leads to a compile failure*** (razor @ syntax does not support whitespaces)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Microsoft.DotNet.Publishing.targets breaks webdeploy zip support" (#555) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
When I create a VS build deployment template in VSTS, it tries building a project or solution with the following arguments:

```
/p:DeployOnBuild=true /p:WebPublishMethod=Package /p:PackageAsSingleFile=true /p:SkipInvalidConfigurations=true /p:PackageLocation="$(build.artifactstagingdirectory)\\"
```

After the move from DNX targets to DotNet targets, this only builds the project rather than outputting a zip file, breaking the VSTS template.

I'm having a hard time trying to figure out how to call msbuild on my xproj file to get it to build a webdeploy compatible zip package that can be deployed with `Publish-AzureWebsiteProject`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Retiring the Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaTemplates package (Aurelia/Knockout/Vue templates)" (#289) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The `Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaTemplates` package never shipped in the .NET Core SDK, and never reached an official level of support. The ASP.NET team's development resources are finite, and we think we can deliver more valuable features to ASP.NET developers by focusing elsewhere.

So:

* The `Microsoft.DotNet.Web.Spa.ProjectTemplates` package, containing **Angular**, **React**, and **React+Redux** templates, is **not affected**. This ships in the .NET Core SDK and is officially supported. We continue to invest development effort in this package. We can put *more* time and effort into these SPA templates now the effort isn't so spread out.
* If you have an existing Aurelia/Knockout/Vue project based on our SPA templates, you're not directly affected because these templates are only used to create new projects. You can continue building and shipping your app forever. Obviously we still support and enhance the underlying ASP.NET Core APIs (such as those in JavaScriptServices) that you are using.
* The `Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaTemplates` package, containing Aurelia, Knockout, and Vue templates, continues to be available, but we'll no longer update it or work on issues related to it.
* We encourage enthusiastic community members to [ship your own `dotnet new` templates](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/custom-templates). The `dotnet new` system is extensible for this exact reason. If you want to own the go-to Aurelia/Knockout/Vue project template, now's your chance! You could [fork the ones from `Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaTemplates`](https://github.com/aspnet/templating/tree/dev/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaTemplates), or start from scratch depending on what you prefer.
* In the long term, if another JavaScript SPA framework becomes dominant, we will of course consider adding a template for it to the SDK templates package.

I know this will be irritating to some people, especially those who have worked on PRs for the Aurelia/Knockout/Vue templates. I'm sorry about that! I hope you can understand that our goal is to offer the overall maximum benefit for ASP.NET developers based on the resources available.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ASP.NET Core 2.1 " (#288) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
*This is high-level only and doesn't include all issues, bugs, etc. from every repo, just intended to give a general idea of release scope and direction.*

The following high-level features are planned for the ASP.NET Core 2.1 release:
- **SignalR** - Real-time web framework on ASP.NET Core (https://github.com/aspnet/SignalR/issues/394)
- **HTTPS** - On by default and easy to configure (https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2308)
- **GDPR compliance** - Templates updated with new privacy features (https://github.com/aspnet/Security/issues/1561, https://github.com/aspnet/Identity/issues/1341)
- **Web API conventions** - Rich Swagger support without attributes (https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/6870, https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/6784)
- **IHttpClientFactory** - HttpClient as a service, handle cross-cutting concerns like caching, retry logic, timeouts and circuit breakers (https://github.com/aspnet/HttpClientFactory/issues/42)
- **ASP.NET Core Module in-proc hosting** - 6x the throughput on IIS! Better startup error handling (https://github.com/aspnet/AspNetCoreModule/issues/265)
- **Razor pages improvements** - Support for areas, ~/Pages/Shared (https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/6926, https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/7193)
- **MVC functional test fixture** - Easily test your MVC apps end-to-end (https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/6233)
- **Build-time Razor** - Compile Razor pages and views as part of your build, improved startup performance (https://github.com/aspnet/Razor/issues/1809)
- **UI as a library** - Package Razor pages and views as reusable libraries (https://github.com/aspnet/Razor/issues/1809)
- **Identity UI package and scaffolder** - Add identity to any application (https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2311)
- **WebHooks** - Handle WebHook notifications from ASP.NET Core apps (https://github.com/aspnet/WebHooks/issues/5)

For more details on each of these features see the [ASP.NET Core 2.1 roadmap](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/webdev/2018/02/02/asp-net-core-2-1-roadmap/) post on the ASP.NET team blog.

Discussion for this issue is at aspnet/Home#2846
